Upper hemicontinuity

Definition

Given A⊂ℝnA \subset \mathbb{R}^n, the closed set Y<ℝkY < \mathbb{R}^k, the correspondence f:A→Yf: A \to Y has a closed graph if for any 2 sequences xm→x∈Ax^m \to x \in A and ym→yy^m \to y with xm∈Ax^m \in A and ym∈f(xm)y^m \in f(x^m) for every mm, we have y∈f(x)y \in f(x).

Notes

A more general form exists in Upper semicontinuous functions dealing with relations or correspondences in general
